page.title: 10INDUSTRY NORTH OF PULBOROUGH
page.content: There is at present no industrial area in our block. The site of a former brickworks at the junction of the A29 and Broomers Hill Lane has now been levelled. Against local opposition the site is scheduled for "small industrial units". A notice advertising this availability has been displayed for some years but no unit has yet been erected. A former industry was iron working. On Pallingham Manor Farm is a cottage called "Furnacepond Cottage" Near here was a hammer pond which fed a hammer mill. Now only the earth platform for feeding iron ore and charcoal into the furnace remains as a raised plateau in a field. Remains of iron slag are found in this field and an adjacent stream. Records show that the mill was working in 1664 but all trace had disappeared by 1720.
